it also supports workflows for a nlp and and there's a in
one of the interesting things about it is that beyond the fact that you can leverage private uh workforces
or public work workforces there are into two very interesting features about it the
first is the annotation consolidation which is the process where ground truth
basically takes the same sample out of the training data and asks different annotators to label it
thus it all it improves the quality of the labeled data but also prevents from
any bias to influence the labeling process and another interesting feature is the
auto labeling um feature which uh where ground truth is randomly selecting 10 of the
data it then tries using that ten percent which it asks labelers to label um it
tries to predict the some of the other labels or some of the other data in the training set for those data that
it has a high level of confidence it doesn't ask
to the annotators to label that data but only for the low confidence thus it really it helps you reduce the
labeling cost by up to 70 percent so before handing it back to tom
